title: Questioning the Transition from Judiciary to Politics: Seeking Insights on Transparency
selftext:
The recent announcement by former Calcutta High Court judge Abhijit Gangopadhyay, resigning from the judiciary to join politics, has ignited a discussion on the appropriateness of such moves by judges. As he gears up to join the BJP, the question arises: What considerations should the public keep in mind when judges transition into political roles?

News articles like those mentioned below shed light on similar instances:

* [Indian Express - Courtroom Politics: Justice Abhijit Gangopadhyay Quits SC Judges, Polls](https://indianexpress.com/article/political-pulse/courtroom-politics-justice-abhijit-gangopadhyay-quits-sc-judges-polls-9196815/)
* [Times of India - Iyer, Hegde, Alam: Netas Who Became Judges and Judges Who Turned Netas](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/iyer-hegde-alam-netas-who-became-judges-and-judges-who-turned-netas/articleshow/97716740.cms)
* [India Legal Live - Judges in Politics](https://www.indialegallive.com/viewpoint/judges-in-politics/)

Now, the question arises: What role can the common public play, and how can we discern whether such transitions into politics are driven by a genuine intent for betterment or personal interest?

Share your thoughts and insights below.
